results.title: Sorrow
results.creator_credit: Peter Sasdy, Barry Levinson and Hemisphere Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storybook International”.
Two brothers are left the same amount of money, but through a series of mishaps one brother becomes poor and his rich brother will do nothing to help him. The tale compares how they both deal with Sorrow and Envy when they meet them. An Hungarian tale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Sasdy, Barry Levinson and Hemisphere Productions

results.title: Sophocles: Oedipus the King
results.brief_description: An Abridged version of Sophocles’ play performed in the 5th century BC amphitheatre at Amphiaralon by the Athens Classical Theatre Company styled on the ancient models. Narrated by Anthony Quayle, it features James Mason as Oedipus, Claire Bloom as Jocasta and Ian Richardson as Tiresias.

results.title: Soopergoop
results.brief_description: Rodney, a raffish cat, is an actor in an animated TV commercial who proudly reveals the process of promoting ‘Soopergoop’, a new breakfast cereal. The commercial aims and selling techniques which are used are revealed in a most amusing manner. Shows how children are exploited by appealing to their desires and how they are manipulated to persuade their parents to buy the fictitious breakfast cereal “Soopergoop”. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels

results.title: Sons of the Anzacs 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian War Memorial
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of the Australian forces in the principal campaigns of World War II, from the Middle East to New Guinea and the Pacific, with special reference to Tobruk and the Kokoda Trail. Includes archival footage and newsreels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian War Memorial

results.title: Sons and lovers 'the dark forest' [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Terry Monagle and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Terry Monagle leads a discussion with a group of students in a program designed to aid understanding of the main characters of D H Lawrence’s novel in the context of the themes which concerned Lawrence in the writing of the novel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Zweck, Terry Monagle and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Songs to remember
results.brief_description: A collection of late 1940s songs with nostalgic visuals of the “good old times” and big band music. Songs include ‘Take me out to the ballgame’ (Men and Maids of Melody), ‘The sidewalks of New York’ (Michael Bartlett) and ‘In the good old summertime’ (Men and Maids of Melody).
results.description: A collection of late 1940s songs with nostalgic visuals of the “good old times” and big band music. Songs include ‘Take me out to the ballgame’ (Men and Maids of Melody), ‘The sidewalks of New York’ (Michael Bartlett) and ‘In the good old summertime’ (Men and Maids of Melody).
